title: Expert N8N Developer: Build Automated Content Scraping & Republication System
description:
# Project Description: Automated Scraping and Content Repurposing System

We are seeking an experienced N8N developer to build an automated content scraping and republication system for our coaching and spirituality business. The system will monitor trending content across social platforms, organize insights in Airtable, and facilitate content repurposing via Repurpose.io.

The ideal solution will scrape daily trends from TikTok, Instagram, YouTube, and Google Trends, store data in a structured Airtable database, and enable seamless republication of our content across multiple platforms with format adaptation. The system should include intelligent scheduling, performance monitoring, and a notification system to alert us about high-potential trends and content performance.

This project requires expertise in N8N workflow automation, web scraping techniques, Airtable configuration, and integration with Repurpose.io. The complete solution should be deployed on a self-hosted VPS with proper security measures and include comprehensive documentation and training.

French or Spanish speaking abilities would be highly appreciated as it would facilitate communication throughout the project.

title: React & Next.js Developer with AWS/EC2 & build AI model Expertise
description:
Experience Level: Mid/Senior-Level- (NO Entry level, please)

Job Overview:

We are looking for a highly skilled React & Next.js Developer with strong experience in AWS (EC2, S3, Lambda, etc.) and building AI model .  The ideal candidate will develop and optimize high-performance web applications while ensuring seamless deployment and scalability on AWS infrastructure.

Key Responsibilities:

- Design, develop, and maintain React.js and/or Next.js applications.
- Assess, develop, and integrate AI models where applicable, ensuring seamless functionality within web applications.

- Optimize application performance, ensuring fast load times and smooth user experience.

- Develop and maintain RESTful APIs and integrate third-party services.

- Deploy, manage, and scale applications using AWS services such as EC2, S3, Lambda, API Gateway, CloudFront, and RDS.

- Monitor and troubleshoot application performance, ensuring uptime and reliability.

Requirements:

- Proficiency in JavaScript, TypeScript, HTML, and CSS.

- Strong experience with AWS services, particularly EC2, S3, Lambda, and CloudFront.

- Solid understanding of database management (PostgreSQL, MongoDB, DynamoDB, etc.).

-Hands-on experience with Docker, Kubernetes, and CI/CD pipelines is a plus.

- Familiarity with authentication and authorization mechanisms (OAuth, JWT, etc.).

- Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work in an agile environment.

Submit your resume, portfolio, and a brief cover letter outlining your experience.

title: Flask Expert Needed
description:
I need a flask expert that can follow the following criteria for my app

Flask App Checklist for High Scalability (1000+ Users Concurrently)
1. Code Structure & Maintainability
(Flask is more lightweight than Django, so we need to structure it well to avoid a messy monolith.)
âœ”ï¸ Use Flask Blueprints for modularity (e.g., users/, billing/, credits/, api/).
âœ”ï¸ Separate files for routes, models, authentication, and utilities (Flask doesnâ€™t enforce structure like Django).
âœ”ï¸ Follow Flask best practices: Use application factory pattern to allow flexible configurations.
âœ”ï¸ Avoid monolithic code by keeping reusable functions in utils/ and moving business logic outside routes.
âœ”ï¸ Decouple services where possible (e.g., separate worker processes for background tasks).
âœ… How it helps:
Prevents spaghetti code that slows down scaling efforts.
Ensures new features can be added without breaking existing functionality.

2. Database Optimization (PostgreSQL)
(Using SQLAlchemy ORM instead of Djangoâ€™s ORM.)
âœ”ï¸ Use SQLAlchemy ORM (or Flask-SQLAlchemy) for database interaction.
âœ”ï¸ Manually create indexes (Index('index_name', Model.field)) since Flask doesnâ€™t auto-index like Django.
âœ”ï¸ Use SQLAlchemy connection pooling (pool_pre_ping=True, pool_size=20, max_overflow=0).
âœ”ï¸ Implement Redis/Memcached caching (e.g., Flask-Caching).
âœ”ï¸ Prevent N+1 query problems by using joinedload() in SQLAlchemy.
âœ”ï¸ Read Replicas: Set up read replicas to distribute database read requests.
âœ… How it helps:
Optimized queries allow faster responses under high load.
Connection pooling prevents too many open database connections.
Redis caching reduces database calls, improving response times.

3. Multi-User Support (1000+ Concurrent Users)
(Flask handles sessions differently than Django.)
âœ”ï¸ Use Flask-Session to store session data in Redis instead of the database.
âœ”ï¸ Generate unique session IDs and store them in Redis for fast lookups.
âœ”ï¸ Use Celery + Redis for async tasks (e.g., processing outputs, deleting old data).
âœ”ï¸ Paginate large dataset queries using Flask-SQLAlchemyâ€™s pagination methods.
âœ”ï¸ Rate limit requests per user/IP to prevent abuse and API overload.
âœ”ï¸ Horizontal Scaling: Deploy multiple Flask instances behind a load balancer.
âœ… How it helps:
Redis prevents database session overload, making Flask faster under heavy load.
Load balancing distributes traffic evenly across multiple servers.
Rate limiting protects against DDoS attacks and server abuse.

4. AWS S3 Bucket (Input/Output Storage)
âœ”ï¸ Store all user-generated content in S3 using boto3.
âœ”ï¸ Use pre-signed URLs for secure file uploads/downloads.
âœ”ï¸ Implement lifecycle policies for automatic old file deletion.
âœ”ï¸ Restrict S3 permissions (ensure private access).
âœ”ï¸ Enable S3 Transfer Acceleration for faster file uploads/downloads globally.
âœ… How it helps:
No server storage needed, reducing system load.
Scalable storage solution that handles millions of files.
Faster access to files globally with S3 Transfer Acceleration.

5. Payments & Credit-Based System (Stripe)
âœ”ï¸ Integrate Stripe API with Flask (stripe-python package).
âœ”ï¸ Implement credit deduction logic only after successful processing.
âœ”ï¸ Build a billing history table in PostgreSQL.
âœ”ï¸ Admin panel for manual credit adjustments (use Flask-Admin or a custom dashboard).
âœ”ï¸ Log failed payment attempts for debugging.
âœ… How it helps:
Prevents fraudulent use of credits.
Ensures users get billed correctly even under high load.

6. Security & Protection
âœ”ï¸ Enforce HTTPS and secure cookies (SESSION_COOKIE_SECURE = True).
âœ”ï¸ Use Flask-JWT-Extended for authentication.
âœ”ï¸ Implement rate limiting using Flask-Limiter.
âœ”ï¸ Enable CSRF protection using Flask-WTF.
âœ”ï¸ Store API keys & secrets in .env files using python-dotenv.
âœ”ï¸ Enable Web Application Firewall (WAF) for extra protection against attacks.
âœ… How it helps:
Prevents API abuse with rate limits.
Protects against unauthorized access and session hijacking.

7. Deployment & Infrastructure (Auto-Scaling)
âœ”ï¸ Use Gunicorn + Nginx for serving Flask in production.
âœ”ï¸ Containerize with Docker (docker-compose.yml for easy deployment).
âœ”ï¸ Enable auto-scaling with AWS ECS/Kubernetes/DigitalOcean Apps.
âœ”ï¸ Set up a load balancer to distribute traffic evenly.
âœ”ï¸ Use health checks to detect and restart failing instances.
âœ… How it helps:
More instances launch automatically when traffic increases.
Load balancing ensures no single server gets overwhelmed.

8. Logging, Monitoring & Error Tracking
âœ”ï¸ Use Sentry or Rollbar for real-time error tracking.
âœ”ï¸ Implement logging for failed payments & user actions.
âœ”ï¸ Monitor app performance using Prometheus + Grafana.
âœ”ï¸ Set up alerts for high database usage or downtime.
âœ”ï¸ Log Celery task failures for debugging async jobs.
âœ… How it helps:
Detects issues before they cause downtime.
Tracks high-usage areas to optimize performance.

9. Scheduled Cleanup Script (S3)
âœ”ï¸ Use a cron job or Celery Beat to delete old files daily.
âœ”ï¸ Store logs of deleted files for debugging.
âœ”ï¸ Delete inactive user-generated files to save storage costs.
âœ… How it helps:
Reduces unnecessary storage costs.
Keeps the system optimized.

10. Documentation & ReadMe
âœ”ï¸ Write a README explaining setup & usage.
âœ”ï¸ Generate API documentation using Flask-Swagger/OpenAPI.
âœ”ï¸ Add code comments for complex logic.
âœ”ï¸ Create Postman collections for API testing.
âœ… How it helps:
Onboards new developers quickly.
Ensures easy API integration for third-party services.

title: n8n Workflow Developer for Google Workspace Email Automation (Self-Hosted)
description:
We are looking for an experienced n8n workflow builder to help us set up an automation in our self-hosted n8n environment.  

The workflow needs to:  
- Monitor Google Workspace email inboxes every 5 minutes for:  
  - Replies from specific email addresses  
  - Replies to threads with specific labels (we are open to setting up filters in Gmail if needed as both specific emails being tracked and threads will change daily)  
- Scale across 61 inboxes, with the ability to update tracked emails or labels daily  
- Trigger actions based on detected replies (Slack notification to specific channel with email inbox that's relevant and potential other info on the reply)

Project Scope:  
1. Initial Workflow Setup & Documentation
   - Work with us over the shoulder to set up the first workflow  
   - Provide clear documentation and explanations so we can replicate the process for additional inboxes  

2. Best Practices & Scalability
   - Advise on the best way to efficiently manage multiple inboxes  
   - Ensure the setup is scalable and maintainable as we continue to add more inboxes  

3. Potential for Ongoing Work
   - We regularly set up similar workflows and may need future support for optimizations and new automations  

Ideal Candidate:  
- Strong experience with n8n (self-hosted)  
- Familiarity with Google Workspace email APIs and best practices for email automation  
- Ability to explain technical processes in a way that our team can understand and implement independently  
- Experience integrating n8n with Slack, Google Sheets, or other automation tools is a plus  

If you have experience with scalable n8n email workflows and can guide us through the setup, weâ€™d love to hear from you!

title: Web Designer Needed for Legacy Succession Planning Business
description:
We are seeking a highly skilled and creative Web Designer to develop a professional and user-friendly website for our legacy succession planning business. The ideal candidate will have significant experience designing functional websites. The ideal candidate will send links to websites demonstrate they can design the functionality we need.

One of the primary functions of the website will be an interactive questionnaire designed to guide users through the legacy succession planning process. Additionally, the site must incorporate an AI-powered financial calculator to provide clients with tax and asset planning insights, as well as integrate various service offerings under one platform.

Phase 1 - Key Functions:

1. Form that accepts user information in the form of multiple choice selections, sliding scales, and typed in answers, then analyzes the information in an AI-powered financial calculator, generates a basic Legacy Succession Plan, and emails a customized, branded, PDF of it to the User
2. Interactive Questionnaire that calculates data input by the user and generates an email to the User
3. Interactive Questionnaire of Clientâ€™s current Wealth Health that calculates data input by the User and generates a Wealth Health Score that is immediately visible on the page.
4. Embedded Youtube Video library that links to Youtube
5. User-friendly payment gateway to receive online payments

Phase 2 - Key Functions:

6. User Login to upload documents to a secure portal - Implement secure client portals for document uploads and interactions.
7. Page where User can purchase and view Video Courses on demand.

Key Responsibilities:

- Design and develop a visually appealing, responsive website that aligns with our brand identity.
- Ensure a clean, minimalist, and luxury aesthetic throughout the website that appeals to high net worth individuals.
- Ensure SEO best practices for improved visibility and search ranking.
- Implement UX/UI best practices to create an intuitive and engaging user experience.
- Integrate a functional payment gateway with a simple, one-step process, that makes it easy for Users to purchase products and make payments
- Develop and integrate Develop and integrate an AI-powered financial calculator
- Develop and integrate interactive questionnaires
- Develop and integrate an interactive questionnaire that generates customized solutions for clients.
- Optimize website speed, performance, and mobile responsiveness.
- Be a team player and work collaboratively with our team to timely refine content presentation and website flow.
- Provide ongoing support and maintenance as needed.

Required Experience

- Proven experience in designing high-end, luxury, and professional websites. We will provide brand guidelines. The layout style should be minimalist, spacious, intuitive navigation.
- Strong portfolio demonstrating expertise in minimalist, clean web design.
- Proficiency in web design tools such as Figma, Adobe XD, Sketch, or similar.
- Knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and CMS platforms (e.g., WordPress, Webflow).
- Experience in UX/UI design with a focus on high-net-worth clientele.
- Understanding of SEO principles and best practices.
- Ability to integrate secure online forms, interactive financial tools, video content, and an interactive questionnaire.
- Experience with AI-powered financial tools or the ability to integrate AI-driven plugins for calculations.

Other Qualifications:

- Familiarity with legal or financial industry websites.
- Experience working with CRM or secure client communication platforms.
- Basic knowledge of branding and typography best practices.
- Strong communication and project management skills.

Application Process:

Interested candidates should submit their resume, portfolio, and a brief proposal outlining their approach to designing a luxury estate planning website. Please include links to relevant past work that showcases your ability to create sophisticated, user-friendly web experiences with the functionality required for this job.

title: Build a Peer-to-Peer Employee Recognition & Rewards Platform (Like Awardco/Bonusly)
description:
I am looking for an experienced full-stack developer/team to build an employee recognition and rewards platform similar to Awardco/Bonusly.

This platform will allow employees to recognize colleagues, allocate points, and redeem rewards while integrating with Slack, Microsoft Teams, and HR software.

If you have experience building SaaS platforms, social engagement tools, or HR tech solutions, this project is a great fit for you.

Key Features:
User Features:
âœ… User Authentication (Email/Password, SSO, OAuth)
âœ… Employee Recognition (Send points with messages, GIFs, & hashtags)
âœ… Rewards System (Gift cards, company perks, custom rewards)
âœ… Recognition Feed (Social-style public recognition board)
âœ… Leaderboards & Gamification (Top recognizers, badges, achievement levels)
âœ… Integrations: Slack, Microsoft Teams, Workday, BambooHR

Admin Features:
âœ… User & Role Management (Admins, Managers, Employees)
âœ… Point Allocation System (Monthly budgets, expiration rules)
âœ… Analytics & Reports (Engagement insights, usage trends)
âœ… Custom Branding (Company logos, colors, themes)

Tech Stack Preference (Flexible):
ðŸ”¹ Frontend: React + Tailwind CSS
ðŸ”¹ Backend: Node.js (Express) OR Django (Python)
ðŸ”¹ Database: PostgreSQL / Firebase
ðŸ”¹ Authentication: Firebase Auth / Auth0 / OAuth
ðŸ”¹ Hosting: AWS / GCP / Vercel
ðŸ”¹ API Integrations: Slack, Teams, HRMS APIs

2. Core Features
2.1 User Management
Sign-up/Login: Users can register/login via email, SSO (Google, Microsoft, etc.), or company-specific OAuth.
Role-based access: Admins, Managers, and Employees with different permissions.
Profile Management: Name, role, department, profile picture, points balance, recognition history.
2.2 Recognition System
Give Recognition: Employees can give points to their colleagues with a message and optional GIFs/emojis.
Custom Recognition Badges: Admins can create badges for achievements (e.g., "Team Player," "Innovator").
Approval Flow: Option for managers to approve recognition (configurable).
Public/Private Recognition: Users can choose whether recognition is visible on a company feed.
2.3 Rewards System
Point System: Employees receive a monthly allowance of points to distribute.
Reward Catalog: Integration with vendors like Amazon, gift cards, and company-specific perks.
Custom Rewards: Companies can create internal rewards (e.g., extra leave, lunch with CEO).
Points Expiry: Admin-configurable expiration for unused points.
2.4 Social Features
Recognition Feed: A live feed showcasing recent recognitions with comments & reactions.
Gamification & Leaderboards: Monthly top recognizers, most recognized employees, etc.
Hashtags & Themes: Custom hashtags for company culture initiatives.
2.5 Integrations
Slack & Microsoft Teams: Recognize colleagues directly from chat platforms.
HRMS Integration: Sync employee data with HR platforms (Workday, BambooHR, etc.).
Single Sign-On (SSO): Google Workspace, Microsoft Azure AD, Okta.
2.6 Admin Panel
Analytics & Reports: Insights on employee engagement, most recognized values, etc.
User & Role Management: Add/remove users, adjust permissions.
Point Allocation Control: Customize monthly budgets, restrict point transfers.

title: Backend of a college admissions website.
description:
Need to develop an entire backend of a website with several functionalities. You will likely need a full team to do this. It is a huge project and we need it done as

Here is the IMS documentation: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1luSQNMP7un_4HvmwVZnjx2qqJ4jIW18FM72UNWz01bo/edit?usp=sharing

Here are some key points from a recent meeting we had too.

1. Client Onboarding & Folder Creation
- Automate the onboarding process within the portal.
- Create a structured client folder system within the portal.
- Integrate with Google Drive (or an alternative) to allow document editing & collaboration.
- Ensure controlled access for clients, parents, and staff to different folder sections.

2. University Application Document Management
- Clients should be able to input their finalized university list.
- Automatically generate university-specific folders (e.g., NYU: main essay, supplemental essays, documents).
- Enable collaborative editing of documents within the portal.

3. Milestone Tracking & Progress Dashboard
-Students should have a visual progress tracker displaying:
-Completed applications, essays, and other required tasks.
-Percentage completion of their admissions journey.
-Automated notifications/reminders for upcoming deadlines (e.g., essay drafts, application submission).
-Parents should have access to view progress updates.

4. Scheduling & Session Tracking
-Integrated calendar system (alternative to Calendly or Traft).
-Students should be able to schedule sessions directly with their assigned advisor or tutor.
-The system should automatically match session types to the appropriate advisor/tutor.
-Track the number of sessions used vs. remaining.
-Session progress tracking (Scheduled, Completed, Not Attended).
-Automated email prompts to upsell additional sessions when students complete a package.

5. Internal Notes & Team Assignments
-Private folders for internal employee-only notes.
-Assign students a support team (e.g., Accountability Coach, Family Support Manager).
-Allow students to schedule meetings with their team members.

6. Affiliate & Referral Program Integration
-Integrate with an external affiliate tracking system (e.g., Push Lap Growth).
-Ensure smooth registration & commission tracking.
-Create forms that direct data into the tracking system without using Google Sheets.

7. Payment & Financial Tracking
-Integrate with Hellum for processing payments (preferred over Stripe).
-Track client payments, outstanding balances, and payment history.

8. Task & Workflow Automation
-Integration with Blue (project management tool) to automatically assign follow-ups.
-Automate task delegation for team members.
-Integrate with Active Pieces (Zapier alternative) for workflow automation.

9. CRM & Email Marketing
-Currently using HubSpot (free version) & DinoSend.
-Explore potential API integrations to improve efficiency without incurring high costs.

10. Hosting & Infrastructure
-Current hosting: SiteGround (expires November 1).
-Evaluate alternatives (e.g., Google servers, Hostinger) to reduce costs.

Project Description:
Context: I have a classified platform for products and real estate that is already developed using Python and MDBootstrap. However, I need to make some improvements in the responsive part to ensure that the platform works correctly on all devices (mobile phones, tablets, and desktops).

Objective: The goal is to optimize the user interface (UI) and improve the user experience (UX), ensuring that the platform is fully responsive and easy to use on any device. The system's base is already built, and the current front-end implementation needs to be reviewed and adjusted where necessary.

Main Tasks:

Review and adjust the responsive design:

Ensure that all pages (home, product/real estate listings, ad details, etc.) adapt correctly to mobile, tablet, and desktop screens.
Ensure that all UI elements such as buttons, search forms, filters, tables, etc., are easily accessible and visually appealing on devices of different sizes.
Interaction optimization:

Review and adjust the navigation, ensuring that the flow between pages is smooth and the design does not interfere with the user experience.
Optimize search forms and filters for mobile devices.
Testing on devices and screen sizes:

Conduct testing on various devices (mobile phones, tablets, and desktops) to ensure the system is fully functional and visually consistent on each one.
Adjust any element that doesnâ€™t look good or isnâ€™t working correctly on these devices.
Optimize images and resources:

If necessary, optimize images and other resources to improve page performance on mobile devices by implementing techniques such as lazy loading or image compression.
Suggestions for improvements:

Provide additional recommendations to enhance the visual and functional aspects of the platform based on best practices for responsive design and UX/UI.
Requirements:

Experience in front-end development using Bootstrap (preferably with MDBootstrap).
Knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and media queries.
Experience in optimizing responsive designs and improving user experience (UX).
Ability to test across different devices and ensure everything works properly on various screen sizes.
What is expected from you?

Deliver a fully optimized and functional platform for mobile phones, tablets, and desktops.
Ensure an improvement in the user experience without radically changing the current system's design or functionality.
Communicate any challenges or recommendations during the optimization process.

title: Senior Python Developer for Web Automation & Tracking Analysis
description:
We are seeking a *Senior Python Developer* with expertise in web automation, browser-based tracking analysis, and data extraction. The ideal candidate should have experience working with headless browsers (Selenium, Playwright), JavaScript execution in Python, and network request monitoring to detect web tracking mechanisms.

Key Responsibilities:
- Develop a Python-based solution to analyze web interactions and detect data-tracking mechanisms.
- Implement headless browser automation to render and process web pages dynamically.
- Extract and analyze network traffic to identify third-party tracking technologies.
- Work with archived web pages to assess historical tracking behavior.
- Handle large datasets, processing multiple URLs efficiently.
- Generate structured reports based on extracted data.

Required Skills & Qualifications:
- Strong Python skills, particularly in web automation and data processing
- Background in web scraping or data forensics using Scrapy.
- Experience with Selenium, Playwright, or Puppeteer for browser automation.
- Ability to execute and interact with JavaScript within a headless browser.
- Knowledge of network request analysis and tracking detection methods.
- Familiarity with working on Wayback Machine or archived web data is a plus.

If you have experience in browser automation, JavaScript execution within Python, and web tracking analysis, weâ€™d love to hear from you! Please share relevant project examples in your application.

title: WP Multisite Tourism Hub (booking, e-commerce, crowdfunding, AR map, AI chatbot) â€“ fixed price
description:
WHO WE ARE

We are an Italian startup that is developing a digital hub to promote integrated services in small tourist towns.
Our goal is to create a scalable, cost-efficient, user-friendly WordPress Multisite platform that provides local communities with a booking system, AI chatbots, interactive maps, crowdfunding features, and a centralized e-commerce solution. Our environment will enable them to manage their own activities with minimal overhead.
We are looking for reliable and highly qualified professionals for long-term collaboration. We do not have a fixed budget; we are open to proposals and will negotiate terms based on approach, scope and deliverables.
Important note: you will only be responsible for system setup, creating robust automation, testing and default templates. Each new customer should automatically get a pre-configured subsite (with relevant functionality) once onboarded. You will not have to manage or change their content on an ongoing basis - our in-house team will handle customer support and configuration after the automated processes are established.
We enjoy to collaborate with freelancers or pre-built teams. Further details about the project will be made known to interested ones.

_______________________________________________

CORE FEATURES & REQUIREMENTS

1. WordPress Multisite setup and automation
- Implement a Multisite environment (wildcard subdomains, SSL) on AWS/GCP.
- Configure a system in which each new client instantly gets a pre-set dashboard and default white-label template upon onboarding, with multilingual support.
- Ensure clear subscription tiers (e.g., Basic/Pro/Premium) where features are enabled or restricted automatically.

2. Booking System
- Integrate or customize a booking plugin (e.g., Bookly, Amelia, Booknetic).
- Provide an automated setup so that new subsites come with pre-configured booking features (clients only adjust their specific info).

3. Crowdfunding Module
- Configure a crowdfunding plugin (e.g., GiveWP, WP Crowdfunding, Charitable).
- Automate the provisioning of crowdfunding features (payment flows, campaign management) for each subsite based on subscription tier.

4. Centralized E-commerce
- Set up a single vendor structure (WooCommerce or similar), where all transactions are handled under one admin account.
- Ensure each subsite can display products/services, but with minimal manual intervention needed for new clients.

5. AI Chatbot Integration
- Embed a chatbot solution via an external API.
- Make it easily replicable on newly created subsites, requiring minimal additional setup.

6. UI/UX & Front-end
- Create 2-3 responsive themes and standardized template for each subsite.
- Include a page builder or a similarly intuitive approach, so local administrators can manage their own content.
- This design should be pre-installed for every new subsite.

7. Testing & Performance
- Conduct end-to-end testing (booking flows, crowdfunding, checkout, permission tiers).
- Optimize performance (caching, CDN, WP security hardening).
- Confirm that newly spun-up sub-sites function correctly â€œout of the box.â€

8. Deployment & Maintenance framework
- Deploy to AWS or Google Cloud and set up robust backups and monitoring.
- Provide a maintenance strategy (updates, patches) that keeps the platform stable without requiring frequent manual intervention for new subsites.

_______________________________________________

DELIVERABLES & SUGGESTED MILESTONES

1. Milestone 1: Discovery + Architecture
- Finalize plugin choices, automation approach for subsite creation, staging setup.
- Deliverable: detailed requirements doc, structure plan, timeline.

2. Milestone 2: Multisite automation
- Implement WP Multisite with wildcard subdomains, membership tiers, automated provisioning scripts.
- Deliverable: new subsite creation tested (with default theme/plugins).

3. Milestone 3: Booking and crowdfunding setup
- Integrate booking and crowdfunding modules in white-label mode.
- Deliverable: automated flow so each new subsite inherits booking/crowdfunding capabilities based on tier.

4. Milestone 4: Centralized e-commerce
- Configure WooCommerce (or similar) for single-vendor transactions.
- Deliverable: product listing functionality available by default on each subsite.

5. Milestone 5: UI/UX + page builder
- Create a standardized theme/template, page builder config.
- Deliverable: finalized front-end â€œstarterâ€ design for subsites.

6. Milestone 6: AI chatbot integration
- Embed external chatbot API with minimal per-subsite setup needed.
- Deliverable: automated chatbot feature included in sub-site creation.

7. Milestone 7: QA and optimization
- Thorough testing (booking flows, e-commerce transactions, crowdfunding, sub-site onboarding).
- Deliverable: bugs fixed, system stable, performance checks passed.

8. Milestone 8: Production deployment and handover
- Launch on AWS/GCP, configure backups/monitoring.
- Deliverable: live platform, final documentation, knowledge transfer.

(Exact milestone structure is flexible; we welcome your input.)

_______________________________________________

KEY SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS

- WordPress multisite expertise: proven experience in multi-tenant architectures, subdomain setups, and automated provisioning.
- Plugin development/integration: familiarity with booking, crowdfunding, e-commerce, membership and many other plugins
- Automation & scripting: ability to create or configure scripts that auto-generate subsites with pre-loaded content, plugins, and settings.
- UI/UX & theme development: ability to craft a standardized, responsive theme or child themes that can be cloned for new subsites.
- Security & performance: understanding of caching (CDN), WP hardening, load testing.
- API Integration: skilled in embedding AI chatbots or similar external services with minimal overhead.
- Cloud hosting (AWS/GCP): comfortable deploying, monitoring, and maintaining a cloud-based infrastructure.
- Strong communication: willing to provide progress updates, collaborate via Google Workspace (or similar) and meet agreed deadlines. Proficiency in English language!

________________________________________

CONTRACT & BUDGET

Fixed-price, organized around milestones.
No fixed budget: we invite you to propose your pricing and timeline!
Third-party services (hosting, plugins, addons etc.) will be quoted separately.
We aim for a 4/6 month timeframe to reach a stable MVP, but we are flexible based on your estimates.
Free company website, extra features or other innovative proposals will be positively evaluated.

________________________________________

WHAT WE EXPECT FROM YOU

1. Proposal & approach
- Describe how you plan to automate subsite creation and ensure all features are immediately available.
- Suggest any improvements or alternate workflows you deem effective.

2. Previous work
- Provide portfolio/examples of relevant WordPress Multisite or multi-tenant WP projects.
- Highlight your experience with white-label integrations, if possible.

3. Pricing & timeline
- Offer a milestone-based or total fixed-price quote.
- Outline approximate weeks or phases needed, plus any assumptions.

4. Team or solo
- Specify if youâ€™re an individual covering multiple areas or a team with distinct roles.

5. Ongoing collaboration
We welcome a long-term relationship for future upgrades, maintenance, and potential feature expansions: we could receive financial support from public agencies that will provide coverage and business continuity.

_______________________________________________

We have a clear vision, but we need talented, dependable professionals to help us realize it. Your role is to set up and automate the underlying infrastructure so that each new client is effectively â€œplug and play.â€ We will handle ongoing customer support and content updates.

Ready to digitize tourism and streamline local community services? Apply now with your best approach, and letâ€™s build something impactful together!

title: WP / CUSTOM SUBMISSION DEV - Magazine For Rollout - Start ASAP - Agencies ONLY
description:
Job Description & Scope of Work (SOW) for Developer

Project Overview -

Please we are a startup and if we secure advertising we can offer an attractive bonus!

Please read the ad carefully.  If you are a PHP WIZ and looking for an AMAZING portfolio piece this is it!  -

The goal is to develop a high-performance, scalable fashion and beauty magazine site in two phases:

PHASE 1 (Prelaunch): Build the MOST Theme landing page with submission forms, payment gateway, Mailchimp integration, full social media API integration, and Google Analytics UTM tracking for influencer links.

PHASE 2 (Hard Launch): Develop the Chronicle Theme with full magazine functionality, all additional integrations, security enhancements, monetization features, and final launch preparations.

PHASE 1: Prelaunch Development

1. MOST Theme Landing Page Setup

Implement MOST Theme (Deadline: TBD

Ensure seamless design and performance.

Optimize for fast loading speeds (Vogue-like performance benchmark).

2. Submission System for Influencers & Writers

Influencer Submission Flow:

Public social login authentication (Google, Apple, Facebook, Instagram).

Submit Instagram/TikTok handles (API fetch for social metrics).

Submission via structured WPForms Pro/Gravity Forms.

Terms & Conditions agreement checkboxes.

Writers Submission Flow:

Private invitation-based registration.

Submission via WPForms/Gravity Forms with approval process.

NDA agreement checkbox.

3. Payment Gateway & Monetization

Install Stripe & PayPal for:

Influencer submissions (optional feature).

Advertising payments & invoicing.

Ensure secure payment processing.

4. Mailchimp Integration & Newsletter Signup

Implement Mailchimp API for email list building.

Add a newsletter signup form to the landing page.

5. Full Social Media API Integration

Fetch influencer social data upon submission.

Instagram API:

Followers, Engagement Rate, Impressions, Reach

Story Insights, Growth Trends, Hashtag Performance

TikTok API:

Followers, Likes, Video Views, Audience Demographics

Click-Through Data from Bio Links

Sync data real-time (30%) and batch updates (70%) for reporting.

6. Google Analytics UTM Tracking for Influencer Links

Implement Google Analytics UTM parameters for tracking influencer-driven traffic.

Capture click-through rates (CTR), referral sources, and conversions.

Set up Pretty Links / ThirstyAffiliates for URL management.

7. Performance Optimization for Prelaunch

Redis Caching for database efficiency.

CDN Implementation for faster image & video loading.

External Storage (Amazon S3) for high-res assets.

Ensure mobile responsiveness and speed optimization.

PHASE 2: Hard Launch Development

1. Chronicle Theme Full Implementation

Transfer Chronicle Theme from APPLE subdomain to RASPBERRY subdomain.

Fully integrate all submission systems and magazine functions.

2. Advanced Monetization & Affiliate Tracking

Implement Google AdSense & Google Ad Manager for ads.

Affiliate Tracking:

Use Pretty Links / ThirstyAffiliates before Skimlinks approval.

Google Analytics UTM parameters for tracking influencer links.

Custom tracking dashboard inside WordPress.

3. Subscription & Paywall System

Implement free newsletter signup.

Develop private password-access content for subscribers.

Implement Stripe for future paid subscriptions.

4. Security & Performance Optimization for Hard Launch

Ensure all caching, CDN, and database optimizations.

Secure site against DDoS, brute force attacks, and SQL injections.

Conduct final load testing & stress testing before launch.

5. Ad & Revenue System Implementation

Implement a banner ad management system in admin.

Ads will include:

Homepage Banners

In-Content Advertisements

Gallery Interstitial Ads

Pre-Roll Video Ads

Leadership, Billboard, MPU, Doublesky

Reference: Glamour Media Kit

Support invoicing for paid ads.

6. Final Magazine Readiness & Launch Prep

Ensure all content uploads & formatting are finalized.

Optimize articles with ACF fields for easy content structuring.

Implement editorial workflows via PublishPress.

Perform final security audit & compliance checks.

Prepare for a smooth and fully optimized launch.

Deliverables & Deadlines

Phase 1 due on or before March 1st

Phase 2 due 1 to 2 weeks later

Final Expectations

PHASE 1 must be fully functional before launch.

PHASE 2 must meet Vogue-level performance benchmarks.

Weekly progress reports are required.

Final approval must ensure a secure, high-performance magazine site.

title: Three.js / react three fiber Developer â€“ 3d medical head
description:
We seek a Three.js specialist to refine the rendering and optimization of a 3D human head. The ideal candidate will ensure realistic visualization, smooth interaction, and efficient performance across desktop and mobile devices.
Key Responsibilities

    Enhance 3D Rendering: Improve the realism of anatomical models using Three.js, optimizing textures and materials.
    Optimize Performance: Implement efficient KTX2 texture compression and Draco 3D model optimization to ensure smooth performance.
    Develop Interactive Features:
        Enable zoom, rotate, and pan functionalities.
        Implement opacity controls for anatomical layers (skin, muscles, vascular structures).
        Create clickable hotspots for anatomical labeling with a two-tier structure:
            General areas (cheeks, nose, jawline).
            Detailed structures (zygomaticus major, nasolabial folds).
    Ensure Scalability & Future Expansion:
        Design a modular architecture to accommodate future AI-driven enhancements.
        Support customizable model views (e.g., age variations, skin textures).
        Integrate pre-set views for medical procedures (e.g., Botox injection sites).

Tech Stack

    Three.js for rendering
    React + React Three Fiber for UI integration
    glTF format for efficient 3D model handling
    KTX2 for texture compression & Draco for model optimization

Preferred Experience

    Strong Three.js expertise with a focus on realistic 3D rendering.
    Experience in 3D model optimization for web applications.
    Knowledge of efficient texture handling (KTX2, compressed textures).
    Familiarity with interactive labeling techniques in Three.js.
    Experience integrating Three.js with React via React Three Fiber.

Application Process

To apply, please submit:

    A brief response to the following questions:
        How would you approach implementing an interactive 3D model viewer using Three.js?
        What are the biggest performance challenges when rendering detailed anatomical models in a browser, and how would you mitigate them?
        What strategies would you use for handling large texture files while maintaining high-quality rendering?
        How would you implement opacity control for anatomical layers while keeping performance optimal?
        Have you worked on a similar 3D visualization project before? If so, can you share examples?
    A high-level project plan outlining your approach.
    A proof of concept (PoC) demonstrating basic Three.js functionality (e.g., loading and interacting with a 3D model).
    An estimated timeline and resource requirements for an MVP.

title: Reformulation Calculator MVP - Development Specification
description:
1. Project Overview

Project Name: Reformulation Calculator
Objective: Enable users to input baking recipes and receive modified versions, such as gluten-free or reduced-sugar alternatives.
A static HTML version currently exists, but it does not perform calculations or store data. The goal is to develop a functional MVP that can eventually be embedded into the existing Square Online website.
________________________________________

2. Key Functional Requirements

A. Frontend Features (User Interface)

1) Recipe Input Page
a) Allow users to input original recipes (ingredient names + weights)
b) Provide dropdown menus or autocomplete to assist with ingredient selection

2) Conversion Result Display
a) Convert the recipe into a gluten-free, reduced-sugar, or other alternative version
b) Display new ingredient names, corresponding weights, and replacement explanations

3) Save & Share Functionality
a) Allow users to download a PDF or copy the converted recipe
b) Enable recipe history saving

4) Responsive Design (Mobile & Desktop Compatible)
a) Ensure the tool functions properly on both mobile and desktop devices

5) Embedding into the Existing Website (Square Online)
a) The calculator should be embeddable into the current (Square Online) website
________________________________________

B. Backend Features (Calculations & Data Processing)

1) API (Conversion Calculations)
a) Receive user-inputted ingredients
b) Query the ingredient database to find suitable replacements
c) Apply conversion rules to calculate the new ingredient weights
d) Return results for display on the frontend

2) Database (Ingredient Data & Conversion Rules Storage)
a) Ingredient database (nutritional information, properties for each ingredient)
b) Replacement rules (e.g., "100g flour â†’ 120g gluten-free flour")
c) Scalability (potential to add AI-generated replacement suggestions in the future)

3) Future Expansion (Optional)
a) User accounts for saving recipes
b) API availability for third-party integrations
________________________________________

3. Development Timeline & Acceptance Criteria

A. Development Timeline (Estimated 3-5 Weeks)
1) Week 1 - Build frontend UI (convert static HTML to an interactive web page)
2) Week 2 - Develop API to handle conversion calculations
3) Week 3 - Set up the database & integrate API
4) Week 4 - Testing & debugging (ensure accurate conversions)
5) Week 5 - UI/UX improvements & additional features (e.g., save recipes)

B. Acceptance Criteria (Ensuring Deliverables Meet Requirements)
1) Users can input a recipe and receive a modified version
2) Conversion calculations are accurate (e.g., 100g flour â†’ 120g gluten-free flour)
3) The tool works on both mobile and desktop devices
4) The calculator can be embedded into the current (Square Online) website
5) Additional Testing
a) Test different ingredient combinations to verify replacement logic
b) Ensure website performance is optimised for fast calculations
________________________________________

4. Developer Requirements (Skills & Responsibilities)

A. Required Developer Skills
â€¢ Frontend (UI Development): React.js (or Next.js), HTML/CSS/JavaScript
â€¢ Backend (API Development): Python (FastAPI) or Node.js (Express)
â€¢ Database (Storage & Processing): PostgreSQL (Supabase) or Firebase
â€¢ Deployment (Cloud Hosting): Vercel (Frontend) + Render (Backend)
â€¢ Experience with iFrame embedding and Square Online limitations is preferred

B. Developer Responsibilities
â€¢ Design & develop frontend UI (consistent with existing website aesthetics)
â€¢ Develop API for recipe conversion calculations
â€¢ Build a database to store ingredients & conversion rules
â€¢ Ensure the calculator can be embedded into Square Online (via iFrame or other methods)
â€¢ Deploy and maintain a functional, stable MVP
________________________________________

5. Budget
â€¢ Budget: Â£800 - Â£1,500 (negotiable)
â€¢ Development Timeframe: 3-5 weeks (depending on developer availability)

title: Expert Guide for Setting Up a Vue.js SPA with Tailwind CSS & ERPNext Integration
description:
I am seeking an experienced developer or consultant to provide hands-on guidance in setting up an initial development environment for a Vue.js Single Page Application (SPA) using Tailwind CSS in Visual Studio Code. This project involves integrating the SPA with an ERPNext backend. The authentication will be handled via ERPNext, with user data provided through a context script, and all communication with the backend will occur through the ERPNext REST API.

**Responsibilities:**  
- **Development Setup:**  
  - Assist with the initial configuration of a Vue.js SPA in Visual Studio Code.  
  - Guide the integration of Tailwind CSS into the project.

- **Backend Integration:**  
  - Explain the process of integrating ERPNext as the backend.  
  - Set up ERPNext authentication and ensure user data is passed correctly via a context script.
  - Demonstrate how to configure and use the ERPNext REST API for communication.

- **Documentation & Best Practices:**  
  - Provide clear, step-by-step documentation and guidance on the setup process.  
  - Share best practices for development, debugging, and security.

**Required Skills:**  
- Proven expertise in Vue.js and building SPAs.  
- Experience with Tailwind CSS integration.  
- Solid understanding of ERPNext, including its REST API and authentication mechanisms.  
- Proficiency with Visual Studio Code.  
- Excellent communication skills in English, with the ability to clearly explain technical concepts.

**Preferred Qualifications:**  
- Prior experience setting up similar integrations or projects.  
- Familiarity with context scripts and user data management in web applications.  
- Knowledge of best practices for secure API communication and SPA architecture.

**Project Timeline:**  
The initial setup guidance is expected to be completed within a mutually agreed timeframe, with the possibility of follow-up consultations if needed.

**How to Apply:**  
Please submit your proposal detailing your relevant experience with Vue.js, Tailwind CSS, ERPNext, and Visual Studio Code. Include any examples or references from similar projects and a brief outline of your approach to this setup. Looking forward to collaborating with you to get this project off the ground!

title: Need a Chrome Plugin to Auto-fill Web Forms Using AI
description:
I am looking for a talented developer to create a Chrome extension that can automatically complete any web form using data from an input file (like a structured document). The plugin should be able to intelligently extract information from the input file and fill out fields on any websiteâ€™s form, regardless of its structure or design.

Requirements:

Input: The plugin should accept an input file (e.g., a resume or structured document) that contains relevant details like name, email, phone number, address, skills, work experience, etc.

AI Integration: The plugin should intelligently scan the document and extract pertinent information. Using AI-powered algorithms, it will then map the extracted details to the appropriate fields in the form (e.g., name, contact details, qualifications).

Cross-Site Functionality: It must be able to handle any form on any website. Whether it's a simple contact form or a detailed job application, the plugin should be flexible and efficient.

Auto-fill Capability: Once the data is extracted from the input file, it should auto-fill the corresponding fields on web forms, making the process seamless for the user.

User Interface: The plugin should be easy to use, with a simple interface where users can upload their input file and initiate the auto-fill process.

Compatibility: Ensure the plugin works with the latest version of Google Chrome and complies with Chromeâ€™s extension guidelines.

Preferred Skills:

Experience in Chrome extension development.
Strong knowledge of AI/ML for document parsing and data extraction.
Familiarity with web form structures and auto-filling techniques.
Experience with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS.
Knowledge of web scraping and handling dynamic web content.
Bonus Skills:

Experience with NLP (Natural Language Processing) to improve document understanding.
Prior work with resume parsing or similar document-to-form automation.

To Apply, please provide:

Your relevant experience in building Chrome extensions or web automation tools.
Examples of similar projects youâ€™ve worked on (if any).
Your approach to how the AI will extract and map data from the input file to the web form fields.

title: gate.io API browser sidepanel
description:
The Process Works as Follows:
Initial Price Determination
The current market price is determined and stored as a reference value.

Opening of Base Positions
Two market positions are opened simultaneously:

Sell (Short): A sell position is opened with a fixed amount of x, e.g., 10 units.
Buy (Long): A buy position is also opened with x, e.g., 10 units.
Placement of Initial Limit Orders
Immediately after opening both positions, two limit orders are placed:

Limit Sell: Above the original purchase price, a sell order is placed with an increased price by x, e.g., 0.05. At the same time, the order size is increased by x, e.g., 10%, resulting in 11 units.
Limit Buy: Below the original selling price, a buy order is placed with a reduced price by x, e.g., 0.05, also with an increased size by x, e.g., 10% (e.g., from 10 to 11 units).
Dynamic Adjustment of Limit Orders
A continuous check is performed to determine whether any of the limit orders have been executed. Once an execution is detected, the system automatically:

Places a new limit order, increasing its size by x, e.g., 10% compared to the previous order.
Adjusts the price of the new limit order by 0.05 (based on the executed price of the last limit order).
Profit Monitoring and Take-Profit
Simultaneously, the total profit of all open positions is monitored. Based on the ratio of unrealized profit (PnL) to the current position size, the percentage gain is calculated. If this reaches 1%, all open positions are closed.

These steps outline when and how sell (Short) and buy (Long) positions, as well as subsequent limit orders, are placed and adjusted during the trading process.

title: Develop AI-Powered Messaging Bot & Tournament Management System for Billard and Snooker Club
description:
I am looking for a skilled developer to build an AI-powered messaging bot integrated with a tournament management website for my billiards/snooker club. The system should automate player registrations, tournament brackets, and match result updates while also integrating a chat-based automation system for smooth interactions.

This project is initially for internal use at my club, but I may expand it into a SaaS product in the future.

Key Features:

    AI Messaging Bot:
        Allow players to register for tournaments based on category (Local, Regional, National) and game type (8-ball, Snooker).
        Send automated messages for tournament schedules, match reminders, and results.
        Allow players and admins to report match results via chat.
        AI-powered chatbot for natural communication with players and admins.
        Ask admins whether to post match results automatically on social media (Facebook, Instagram).

    Tournament Management Website:
        Admin dashboard to create and manage tournaments.
        Automated bracket generation and progression based on match results.
        Player profiles and ranking system.
        Live tournament tracking with schedules and results.

    Automated Workflow:
        Admin creates a tournament via the website.
        Players receive chat messages and confirm participation.
        Admin approves registrations manually.
        System generates tournament brackets automatically.
        Players receive match notifications and play.
        Admin reports results via chat, and brackets update automatically.
        System updates schedules and next matchups.
        Optional: Admin decides whether to post results on social media.

Suggested Tech Stack (Flexible, Open to Suggestions):

    AI/NLP: OpenAI (ChatGPT API) or similar.
    Frontend: React, Vue.js, or similar.
    Backend: Node.js, Django, or Laravel.
    Database: PostgreSQL/MySQL.
    Hosting: AWS, Firebase, or DigitalOcean.

Ideal Candidate:

    Experience with chatbot automation.
    Strong AI chatbot and NLP experience.
    Previous experience with tournament management systems is a plus.
    Full-stack development skills.
    Strong communication and ability to suggest improvements.

Budget & Timeline:

    This is an MVP for internal use, so I need a fast, functional solution.
    Please provide an estimated cost and timeframe in your proposal.

If you're interested, please reply with:

    Examples of relevant past projects (especially chatbots or tournament systems).

Additionally, our Angular front-end applications interact with Alfresco through its APIs for GET and POST operations.

We have a staging environment that is a replica of the live system for testing purposes before rolling out the upgrade in production. The total size of our alfdata is approximately 4TB. A few customizations have been made, with most jar files available for review during the upgrade process.

Current System Summary:

Alfresco Version: 5.1.0 (r127059-b7)
Edition: Community
Schema Version: 10,001
Java Version: 1.8.0_65 (Oracle Corporation)
Operating System: Linux (Kernel 4.4.0-71-generic)
Total Memory (GB): 29.89 (Free: 24.65)
CPUs: 16

Timeline: Estimate timelines for both the test and live upgrades.

Challenges: Identify and communicate any potential challenges in the upgrade.

If this initial project is successful, there will be opportunities for further collaboration on related tasks. We are ready to start as soon as we agree on the terms. Only Qualified individuals who have previously done similar upgrades apply for the same.

title: MudBlazor Developer for Small Enhancements in Our Application
description:
We are looking for a skilled MudBlazor developer to assist with small but impactful improvements in our application. The tasks involve working with a database-driven document system, UI enhancements, and document generation in C#.

Tasks:

1. Dynamic File Name Replacement:
We have a database table that stores document file names in the format: ((firstName_lastName))_foo1.pdf
((CompanyName))_foo2.pdf

When a user interacts with a document, we need to replace the information inside brackets with the actual user's details.

Example: If the user is John Doe, the file should be renamed to John_Doe_foo1.pdf.


2. Enhancing the Document Dialog:
We display a list of documents related to an application in a dialog, pulling the data from the database.

We want to add a button that allows users to attach additional documents that were not originally retrieved from the database.


3. Generating Tables in DOCX Files:
We use DOCX template files that are edited dynamically in code.

We need to generate a table within these documents to display a list of services provided to a customer, their prices, and the total amount (similar to a receipt).

All necessary data is stored in a database table.

Requirements:
Experience with MudBlazor and Blazor applications.

Strong knowledge of C# and Entity Framework (or any ORM for database interactions).

Experience working with file handling in .NET (renaming, generating, and modifying documents).

Familiarity with document generation in .NET, particularly working with DOCX templates (e.g., using OpenXML, DocX, or similar libraries).


Additional Information:
This is a short-term project, but we may have additional tasks in the future.

Next Steps

title: AI-Powered WhatsApp Bot & Tournament Management System for a Billiards Club and Many sports
description:
I am looking for a skilled developer to build an AI-powered messaging bot integrated with a tournament management website for my billiards/snooker club. The system should automate player registrations, tournament brackets, and match result updates while also integrating a chat-based automation system for smooth interactions.

This project is initially for internal use at my club, but I may expand it into a SaaS product in the future.

Key Features:

    AI Messaging Bot:
        Allow players to register for tournaments based on category (Local, Regional, National) and game type (8-ball, Snooker).
        Send automated messages for tournament schedules, match reminders, and results.
        Allow players and admins to report match results via chat.
        AI-powered chatbot for natural communication with players and admins.
        Ask admins whether to post match results automatically on social media (Facebook, Instagram).

    Tournament Management Website:
        Admin dashboard to create and manage tournaments.
        Automated bracket generation and progression based on match results.
        Player profiles and ranking system.
        Live tournament tracking with schedules and results.

    Automated Workflow:
        Admin creates a tournament via the website.
        Players receive chat messages and confirm participation.
        Admin approves registrations manually.
        System generates tournament brackets automatically.
        Players receive match notifications and play.
        Admin reports results via chat, and brackets update automatically.
        System updates schedules and next matchups.
        Optional: Admin decides whether to post results on social media.

Suggested Tech Stack (Flexible, Open to Suggestions):

    AI/NLP: OpenAI (ChatGPT API) or similar.
    Frontend: React, Vue.js, or similar.
    Backend: Node.js, Django, or Laravel.
    Database: PostgreSQL/MySQL.
    Hosting: AWS, Firebase, or DigitalOcean.

Ideal Candidate:

    Experience with chatbot automation.
    Strong AI chatbot and NLP experience.
    Previous experience with tournament management systems is a plus.
    Full-stack development skills.
    Strong communication and ability to suggest improvements.

Budget & Timeline:

    This is an MVP for internal use, so I need a fast, functional solution.
    Please provide an estimated cost and timeframe in your proposal.

If you're interested, please reply with:

    Examples of relevant past projects (especially chatbots or tournament systems).
    Your suggested approach to building this system.
    An approximate price quote for the development.

title: Excel/Baserow/Database/Python developer to help organize vehicle data, product files and photos
description:
I need to organize vehicle data, product files, and product photos, create SKUs, design product imagery, and list items on eBay using 3DSellers.

*The Problems Iâ€™m Facing*

- My current setup has issues that need fixing:

- Too Many Spreadsheets: I use 162 Google Sheets (one per manufacturer, vehicle type, and product type) to track vehicle data and make SKUs. Itâ€™s getting harder as I add more vehicles.
- Tricky Vehicle Data: Matching my data (e.g., Mitsubishi L200 with model codes KA4, KB4, etc., and engine codes 4M40, 4D56, etc., from 96-06) to eBayâ€™s list is tough. Their details (e.g., 05-2015, 4M40-A) donâ€™t always match mine.

- Urgent Listings: I need to list 100 items on eBay soon, so I need a fast solution.

- Hard to Scale: Managing files, photos, and eBay compatibility manually wonâ€™t work as my collection grows.

- Delivery and Photos: Files need ISOs/ZIPs, and photos (1 disc image, 22-24 product images per item) need better automation.


The project has two phases:
- Short-Term Plan (Next Few Days): Use spreadsheets to list ~100 items on eBay quickly as a test.
- Long-Term Plan (Over Time): Build a strong, automated system step by step, while I keep listing items.


*My Vision*

I want a simple, automated system on TrueNAS that:
- Organizes vehicle data (e.g., make, model, year) for eBay listings.

- Manages product files in Product Library and product photos in -Product_Photos_and_Mockups, with unique SKUs that include a custom hash.

- Creates eBay listings (parent, variation, or standalone) using CSV Files uploaded to 3dsellers, with correct fitment details for cars and motorcycles.

- Lets me add new features over time while I list items.

title: Bubble / Thunkable App Development for Investor Tracking App
description:
We are seeking a skilled Bubble developer to rapidly create an application that tracks investor trades utilizing the SEC's EDGAR API, as well as News and RSS feeds.

The app should be built in Bubble, and have a highly intuitive user-friendly interface. It will be organized in three main tabs:

- Investors: an overview with cards view showing the profiles of key investors, which when clicked will provide a detailed view of the profile and their trading history. Users arer able to add investor to their watchlist from both overview and detail views.
- Watchlist Trades: shows the most recent trades by the investors added to the user's watchlist, pulled in / synchronized via the SEC's EDGAR API, and potentially other sources like Alpha Vantage or IEX Cloud for real-time stock data.
- Newsfeed (lower priority) displays real-time news from Google Alerts and RSS feeds, for the investors on the user's watchlist.
- Notifications: where user can manage notification settings. The platform should be able to send notifications based on the Watchlist Trades and Newsfeed via email using Zapier + Twilio (or similar), and using OneSignal or Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM) or similar for push notifications.

Once the prototype is developed on Bubble, we will create a Mobile App by converting the Bubble app, using a tool like Thunkable or Adalo.

The ideal candidate should be able to build out a rapid prototype of the platform really quickly, and rapidly develop and customize the features to get a prototype out asap. You should have extensive experience using Bubble, as well tools like Thunkable, and API integrations including Zapier / Make.

If you are passionate about building fast, and creating innovative applications and have a keen eye for detail, we would love to hear from you.

title: Flutter Developer Needed for Dynamic Homescreen Widget for Streak Display
description:
I am seeking a developer with expertise in native Android and iOS development to create a streak widget for my Flutter-based math application. The widget should closely resemble Duolingo's streak widget in functionality and design.

Key Requirements:

1. Integration with Flutter:

The project is part of a Flutter application.

The background for the home screen widget will be determined in the Flutter code.

Relevant variables (e.g., whether the user has completed their daily lesson) will be supplied, but the backgrounds will not be fetched from the backend.



2. Widget Design & Components:

The widget should include:

A widget background (stored on the frontend).

A streak icon.

Streak text displaying the number of consecutive days (e.g., 1, 2, 3, etc.).


I will provide all widget backgrounds, as well as an example image to illustrate the desired design, including the exact positioning of the streak text, streak icons, and other elements.



3. Dynamic Backgrounds and Icons:

Backgrounds: There will be multiple options for widget backgrounds:

If the user has not completed their daily lesson, the widget should randomly select from five options designated for this state. (I have attached example layouts)

If the user has completed their daily lesson, the widget should randomly select from five different options.


Streak Icon: The streak icon should dynamically change based on whether the user has completed their daily lesson.



4. Conditional Updates:

The streak text color (e.g., 1, 2, 3) should be gray if the user has not completed their daily lesson.

Both the streak icon and the widget background should reflect the completion status of the daily lesson.



5. Live Updates:

The widget must support real-time updates to ensure it reflects changes immediately after a user completes a lesson.

This could involve implementing a listener or similar mechanism to synchronize the widget state dynamically.



6. Confidentiality:

As part of this project, you will be required to sign a Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA) to ensure confidentiality and the protection of intellectual property.




If you are interested and meet these requirements, please reach out. I will provide the necessary resources, including widget backgrounds, example images, and backend variables for the project.



Requirements:  
- Fetch streak and lesson completion status dynamically from the backend whenever the homescreen is opened or updated.  
- The widget should work seamlessly for both iOS and Android platforms.  
- Use any Flutter package necessary to implement the functionality efficiently.  
- Fix Directory Issues: Resolve missing or broken folders in my Android and iOS directories to ensure compatibility with the existing project.  
- Platform Detection: Ensure the app can dynamically detect whether the user is on iOS or Android and use the appropriate native implementation.
Make any necessary changes on the Flutter side to guarantee compatibility and proper integration with platform-specific features.
- Code Responsibility: You will be responsible for making the necessary changes to the Flutter codebase to ensure seamless functionality of the widget.

Deliverables:  
1. Fully functional widget code for both iOS and Android platforms.  
2. Ensure dynamic fetching and updates of streak and lesson completion data.  
3. Fix any issues with my current Android and iOS project directories.  
4. Provide all source code files and ensure compatibility with my existing project.
5. Make the n

Additional Requirements:  
- NDA: You must sign a Non-Disclosure Agreement before starting the project.  
- Code Ownership: Upon completion and payment, the code will become my property, and you must destroy any copies.  
- Fixed Price: Provide a fixed price for the project.  
- Confidentiality: You are not allowed to share the code or any details of this project with others.  

Preferences:  
- Experience with creating homescreen widgets for Flutter.  
- Strong debugging skills to resolve directory and compatibility issues.  

If you are interested, please share:  
1. Examples of similar work you have done in Flutter.

title: IPTV App Development for Smart TV (M3U Playlist Support)
description:
We are looking for an experienced developer to create a custom IPTV application for Smart TVs that supports M3U playlists. The app should be user-friendly, optimized for smooth performance, and compatible with major Smart TV platforms (Samsung Tizen, LG webOS, Android TV, and possibly others).
Key Features:

    Support for M3U and M3U8 playlist formats
    EPG (Electronic Program Guide) support
    Favorites list and channel categorization
    Fast and smooth streaming with adaptive bitrate support
    Multi-language support (including Albanian)
    Simple and modern UI/UX design
    Parental control options
    Ability to resume playback from last watched position
    Lightweight and optimized for low-latency streaming
    Remote control navigation support

Requirements:

    Experience in IPTV app development
    Strong knowledge of Smart TV development (Tizen, webOS, Android TV)
    Familiarity with video streaming protocols (HLS, RTMP, etc.)
    Ability to implement a custom video player with multiple format support
    Experience with UI/UX design for TV interfaces
    API integration for EPG and other metadata services
    Strong debugging and performance optimization skills

If you have experience developing IPTV applications and can deliver a high-quality solution, please submit your proposal with examples of previous work.

title: WordPress Store Third-Party Supplier Integration

Connect and sync inventory from two third-party suppliers via their APIs.

Testing & Deployment:

Additional Details:

Open to recommendations on the best way to handle the integration efficiently.

title: Automated Airbnb Management System Development
description:
Request for Proposal (RFP) â€“ Automated Airbnb Management System Development
Project Title: Development of an Automated Airbnb Management System with ChatGPT Integration

Introduction
I am seeking experienced developers (individuals or teams) to build a comprehensive Airbnb Management System that will:

âœ… Automate guest communication via ChatGPT.
âœ… Assign cleaning and maintenance tasks automatically.
âœ… Manage breakfast (donut/bagel) deliveries based on guest preferences.
âœ… Provide a web-based dashboard for desktop users (via Chrome, Edge, and Safari).
âœ… Provide mobile apps for iOS/Android phones & tablets for crew task management and photo uploads.
âœ… Automate routine Airbnb operational tasks to improve guest satisfaction and increase 5-star reviews.

The solution must be modular to allow future feature upgrades. The developer will be required to sign a Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA) before starting the project.

Project Goals & Key Features
The app must include the following features:

1. Airbnb Data Extraction Module
Objective: Extract guest messages, booking details, and reservation data from Airbnb.

âœ… Use one of the following methods:

Airbnb API (preferred if access is available).
Email Parsing (via IMAP/Gmail/Outlook â€“ preferred for reliability).
Web Scraping (as a backup method if other options fail).
âœ… Extract details such as:

Guest name
Check-in/Check-out dates
Special requests
Guest inquiries
âœ… Data will be securely stored in a structured database for ChatGPT to access.

2. ChatGPT-Powered Messaging & Task Automation Module
Objective: Automate guest communication and crew task creation using ChatGPT.

âœ… Automatically respond to common guest questions (e.g., check-in instructions, WiFi details).
âœ… Assign cleaning and maintenance tasks based on:

Booking details (e.g., check-out time triggers cleaning task).
Guest-reported issues (e.g., plumbing leak triggers handyman task).
âœ… Manage urgent issues by alerting the host directly.
âœ… Handle back-to-back bookings by auto-scheduling additional cleaners when required.
3. Cleanerâ€™s App (iOS/Android)
Objective: Provide a mobile app for cleaners to manage cleaning schedules and upload proof-of-cleaning photos.

âœ… Features:

Display assigned cleaning schedules.
Auto-notify cleaners about urgent or back-to-back cleaning needs.
Require cleaners to upload photos of completed cleaning as proof.
Alert the host when the task is completed.
4. Maintenance Crew App (iOS/Android)
Objective: Provide maintenance teams with an app for task management and proof-of-repair uploads.

âœ… Features:

Display assigned maintenance schedules.
Auto-notify the crew about urgent issues.
Require the crew to upload proof-of-repair photos.
Alert the host when the task is completed.
5. Donut/Bagel Delivery Automation
Objective: Automate breakfast delivery scheduling based on guest preferences.

âœ… After booking confirmation, ChatGPT will message the guest:

"Would you prefer bagels or donuts, and what time would you like them delivered?"

âœ… Schedule orders for delivery at the guest's preferred time.
âœ… Integrate with:

Local bagel/donut shop (API integration if available).
Uber Eats, DoorDash, or Instacart API if no direct API is available.
âœ… Send guests a confirmation message when the order is placed and when it arrives.
6. Host Alert & Payment Management System
Objective: Provide a secure system for tracking completed tasks and generating payments for crew members.

âœ… Alert the host when cleaning or maintenance tasks are marked complete.
âœ… Display uploaded proof-of-completion photos for review.
âœ… Generate payment requests for completed tasks.
âœ… Provide the host with a one-click payment approval system.
âœ… Integrate with Zelle API (or manual approval) for payouts.

7. Web Dashboard (For Desktop Users)
Objective: Provide a powerful web interface for managing bookings, messages, and tasks.

âœ… Accessible via Chrome, Edge, and Safari.
âœ… Features include:

Guest communication via ChatGPT-generated responses.
Calendar view of cleaning & maintenance schedules.
Dashboard to review proof-of-completion photos.
Payment approval and financial tracking.
8. Common Airbnb Operational Automations
Objective: Automate common tasks to ensure smooth operation.

âœ… Automatically send:

Check-in instructions the day before arrival.
Check-out reminders on departure day.
Follow-up review requests to encourage 5-star reviews.
âœ… If a review is less than 5 stars, ChatGPT will follow up to resolve the issue.

Technical Requirements
âœ… Backend Technologies: Python (Django/FastAPI), Node.js.
âœ… Frontend (Web Dashboard): React.js (Web) with a responsive layout for mobile browsers.
âœ… Mobile Apps for Cleaners/Maintenance Crew: React Native (iOS & Android).
âœ… AI Integration: OpenAIâ€™s ChatGPT API for intelligent guest responses and task generation.
âœ… Database: PostgreSQL, MySQL, or Firebase.
âœ… Cloud Hosting: AWS (preferred) or DigitalOcean.
âœ… Third-Party Services:

Twilio API (for SMS reminders).
Google Calendar API (for task scheduling).
Zelle API (or manual payment tracking).
Uber Eats API / DoorDash API (for donut/bagel delivery automation).
Deliverables
The developer must provide:

âœ… A fully functional system with all outlined features.
âœ… Source code with clear documentation.
âœ… A design schematic detailing system architecture before development begins.
âœ… An admin guide on managing, maintaining, and troubleshooting the system.

Milestones & Payment Schedule
Payment will be made in the following milestones:

1ï¸âƒ£ 10% Payment â€“ Upon completion and approval of the design schematic.
2ï¸âƒ£ 40% Payment â€“ Upon delivery of a beta version for testing.
3ï¸âƒ£ 40% Payment â€“ Upon delivery of the final version with all features implemented.
4ï¸âƒ£ 10% Payment â€“ After one month of successful use with all bugs and issues resolved.

Timeline & Deadlines
Phase Modules Timeline
Phase 1 Design Schematic 2 weeks
Phase 2 Beta Version (All Features for Testing) 6-8 weeks
Phase 3 Final Version Delivered 2-3 weeks
Phase 4 1-Month Post-Launch Support Ongoing
ðŸ•’ Total Timeline: ~10-12 weeks

Proposal Submission Requirements
Interested developers must provide:

âœ… A brief introduction of their experience with relevant technologies.
âœ… Links to previous projects (especially with ChatGPT, scheduling apps, or Airbnb-related automation).
âœ… An estimated timeline for each milestone.
âœ… A clear outline of their development approach.

Evaluation Criteria
Proposals will be evaluated based on:

âœ… Technical expertise.
âœ… Relevant project experience.
âœ… Clear development plan and understanding of requirements.
âœ… Competitive pricing.

Intellectual Property & NDA
The developer must sign an NDA before starting the project.
Upon project completion, all code, design documentation, and intellectual property will be transferred to me.

-------------------------------------------------------------

title: UI Path Developer
description:
We are looking for an experienced RPA Developer to build an automation solution that integrates with multiple systems of recordâ€”such as Yardi, Elite, Happy, and MRIâ€”to extract data. The integration will enable customers to sync with their system of record within their secure environment. The solution will test connectivity using user-provided credentials and automatically download a sample 50058 form to validate that data extraction works as expected.

This project will be based on detailed video walkthroughs and written documentation provided by our team. All testing will be conducted in-house; direct production access will not be granted.

Key Responsibilities:

Develop the RPA Automation Workflow:

Build a solution using a leading RPA platform (preferably UiPath Studio) that replicates the following process:
System Selection:
Provide a dropdown allowing users to choose their system of record (Yardi, Elite, Happy, MRI, Other). For â€œOther,â€ display a message that our team will follow up.
Credential & Configuration Input:
Display dynamic form fields for supported systems to capture necessary details such as user ID, password, and any additional connection parameters (e.g., URL/endpoint).
Connectivity Testing:
Implement a â€œTest Connectionâ€ feature to verify that a connection to the selected system can be successfully established.
Data Extraction:
Automatically download a sample 50058 form following a successful connectivity test to ensure that the extraction process functions correctly.
Feedback & Error Handling:
Provide clear success messages or error feedback, with logs to assist in troubleshooting.
Iterative Development:

Develop based on our comprehensive video and written guides.
Deliver initial versions for in-house testing; refine the workflow iteratively based on detailed feedback.
Documentation:

Provide complete, well-documented source code and project files (e.g., UiPath XAML workflows, configuration files).
Include detailed deployment and maintenance instructions.
Participate in a handover session to explain the solution and address any follow-up questions.
Security & Best Practices:

Implement secure coding practices, especially for handling user credentials and sensitive connection data.
Ensure the solution is robust, maintainable, and scalable for future enhancements.
Required Qualifications:

Proven experience in RPA development using tools such as UiPath Studio, Automation Anywhere, or Blue Prism.
Strong background in automating desktop applications and handling UI interactions.
Experience building dynamic workflows with parameterized inputs and connectivity testing.
Excellent problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and robust error handling practices.
Strong communication skills and the ability to work iteratively using detailed documentation and video walkthroughs.
Familiarity with integration projects in secure or regulated environments is a plus.
Project Workflow & Environment:

Documentation-Driven Development:
You will receive detailed video walkthroughs and written guides outlining every step of the process.

No Direct Production Access:
All testing will be performed in-house on the production environment by our team; you will work solely with provided documentation and feedback.

Iterative Feedback Loop:
Develop, deliver, test, and refine the solution until it meets our requirements for both connectivity and data extraction (specifically the automated download of a sample 50058 form).

Future Scalability:
The solution will be designed for repeatability so it can be used across multiple customer environments by simply updating credentials and minor configuration details.

If you are an experienced RPA developer who can work with detailed documentation and deliver a secure, robust automation solution without direct system access, weâ€™d love to hear from you. Please include examples of similar projects in your proposal and a brief description of your approach to handling iterative feedback in a controlled environment.

The server status shows as "Server Online" (in green text)

Server is running and responding to requests âœ…
